author: S√∂nke Brederlow
title: Trauriger Jahrestag der Formel 1: Als Frankreich sein gr√∂√ütes Talent verlor
text:
Trauriger Jahrestag der Formel 1: Als Frankreich sein gr√∂√ütes Talent verlor
Der 17. Juli 2015 geh√∂rt zu den schwarzen Tagen der Formel-1-Geschichte: Vor zehn Jahren starb Jules Bianchi an den Folgen seines schweren Unfalls.
Nizza ‚Äì Der 17. Juli 2015 z√§hlt zu den dunkelsten Tagen in der Geschichte der Formel 1: An diesem Tag verliert Jules Bianchi den langen Kampf um sein Leben. Der Franzose war bereits neun Monate zuvor, beim Gro√üen Preis von Japan 2014 in Suzuka, so schwer verungl√ºckt, dass er das Bewusstsein nie wiedererlangte. Er wurde nur 25 Jahre alt.
Jules Bianchi, geboren am 3. August 1989 in Nizza, absolvierte zwar nur 34 Rennen in der Formel 1, galt jedoch als eines der gr√∂√üten Talente im internationalen Motorsport. Die Leidenschaft f√ºr den Rennsport wurde ihm gewisserma√üen in die Wiege gelegt: Vater Philippe betrieb eine eigene Kartstrecke, auf der Jules bereits im Alter von drei Jahren seine ersten Runden drehte.
Auch in der Familie gab es motorsportliche Vorbilder. Gro√üvater Mauro Bianchi war in der Sportwagen-Weltmeisterschaft erfolgreich, Gro√üonkel Lucien Bianchi startete in der Formel 1 und feierte 1968 sogar den Gesamtsieg beim 24-Stunden-Rennen in Le Mans. Dass auch Jules Bianchi eines Tages zu den herausragenden Rennfahrern der Welt z√§hlen w√ºrde, daran bestand kaum ein Zweifel.
Jules Bianchi sollte f√ºr Ferrari in der Formel 1 fahren
Bianchi k√§mpfte sich √ºber die Nachwuchsklassen bis in die Formel 1, feierte sein Deb√ºt in der K√∂nigsklasse im M√§rz 2013 beim Gro√üen Preis von Australien in Melbourne. Ein Jahr sp√§ter, in der Saison 2014, sorgte der Franzose ausgerechnet bei seinem Heimrennen in Monaco f√ºr Aufsehen, als er mit einem neunten Platz sowohl f√ºr sich als auch das unterlegene Marussia-Team die ersten WM-Punkte einfahren konnte.
Nicht nur dank dieses Erfolgs wurde er hinter den Kulissen bereits als m√∂glicher Nachfolger von Kimi R√§ikk√∂nen bei Ferrari gehandelt. Als Mitglied der Ferrari Driver Academy galt Bianchi als einer der vielversprechendsten Kandidaten f√ºr ein k√ºnftiges Cockpit bei der Scuderia.
‚ÄûEr war unser Mann der Zukunft, wenn einmal der Vertrag mit Kimi R√§ikk√∂nen endet‚Äú, verriet der damalige Ferrari-Pr√§sident Luca di Montezemolo gegen√ºber Sky Sport Italia. Doch dazu kam es nie: Am 5. Oktober 2014 nahm das Leben des talentierten Franzosen eine tragische Wendung.
Ein verregneter Tag im Oktober 2014, der alles ver√§ndert ...
Der Gro√üe Preis von Japan auf dem Suzuka International Racing Course war von Regen gepr√§gt, die Bedingungen f√ºr die Fahrer entsprechend schwierig. In Runde 42 kam Sauber-Pilot Adrian Sutil von der Strecke ab und blieb im Kiesbett stecken. Um den Wagen bergen zu k√∂nnen, wurden gelbe Flaggen geschwenkt, und ein Bergefahrzeug r√ºckte auf die Strecke aus.
Nur einen Umlauf sp√§ter, in der 43. Runde des Rennens, ereignete sich der folgenschwere Unfall: Bianchi, zu diesem Zeitpunkt im Marussia unterwegs, war offenbar zu schnell unterwegs und verlor an gleicher Stelle wie Sutil die Kontrolle √ºber seinen Wagen. Sp√§tere Untersuchungen ergaben, dass Bianchi nur 2,61 Sekunden sp√§ter mit etwa 120 km/h in das Heck des Bergefahrzeugs prallte.
Der Kopf des jungen Franzosen wurde dabei mit einer Verz√∂gerung von 254 g belastet. Bianchi zog sich schwerste Sch√§delverletzungen zu und verlor auf der Stelle das Bewusstsein. Die Rettungskr√§fte waren schnell vor Ort und begannen umgehend mit lebensrettenden Ma√ünahmen. Drei Runden sp√§ter wurde das Rennen abgebrochen und Lewis Hamilton zum Sieger erkl√§rt.
Zum Feiern war zu diesem Zeitpunkt bereits niemandem zumute, denn die Nachricht von Bianchis Zustand verbreitete sich rasch. Weil der Helikopter bei den widrigen Wetterverh√§ltnissen nicht starten konnte, wurde der verletzte Franzose per Rettungswagen in das n√§chstgelegene Krankenhaus nach Yokkaichi gebracht. Dort erfolgte eine Notoperation, anschlie√üend wurde Bianchi in ein k√ºnstliches Koma versetzt.
Bianchis Unfalltod hat die Formel 1 nachhaltig ver√§ndert
Auch seine Familie reiste umgehend aus Frankreich an und traf bereits am folgenden Tag in Japan ein. Doch Bianchis Zustand blieb auch in den folgenden Tagen weiterhin kritisch. Zwar atmete er selbstst√§ndig, als er nach mehreren Wochen aus dem Koma geholt und in die Heimat nach Nizza verlegt wurde, aber das Bewusstsein erlangte er auch in den folgenden Monaten nicht wieder.
Am 17. Juli 2015 erlag Jules Bianchi schlie√ülich seinen schweren Kopfverletzungen. Es war der bislang letzte t√∂dliche Unfall in der Formel 1, doch einer, der die K√∂nigsklasse nachhaltig ver√§nderte. So setzte sich der Automobil-Weltverband FIA infolge des Unfalls f√ºr die rasche Einf√ºhrung des Halo-Systems ein. Auch der Einsatz des Safety-Cars geh√∂rt in vergleichbaren Situationen l√§ngst zum Standard.
Die Startnummer 17, die Bianchi zu seiner Zeit im Marussia trug, wird ihm zu Ehren seither nicht mehr vergeben. Sein einst f√ºr Ferrari vorgesehenes Cockpit √ºbernahm schlie√ülich Charles Leclerc, und damit kein Geringerer als Bianchis Patenkind. Auch Leclerc drehte seine ersten Runden auf der Kartbahn von Bianchis Vater und war mit dem Franzosen eng befreundet. Zumindest ein Teil des verstorbenen Franzosen ist der Formel 1 damit bis heute erhalten geblieben. (SoBre)

author: Brian MacMillan
title: Seattle weather: Showers expected for Halloween trick-or-treating
text: Seattle weather: Showers expected for Halloween trick-or-treating SEATTLE - [Showers will push through western Washington on Halloween](https://www.fox13seattle.com/weather/few-showers-halloween-evening-rain) and could become more widespread after sunset. Temps will be cool this afternoon with [light showers developing](https://www.fox13seattle.com/weather/breezy-wind-rain-mountain-snow-wednesday) and highs in the low 50s. It will be cool with showers at times on Halloween in Western Washington. (FOX 13 Seattle) Don't forget the umbrellas tonight as you head out trick-or-treating. Showers will become more widespread as the night goes on. Rain showers will arrive just in time for trick-or-treating around the Seattle area. (FOX 13 Seattle) Snow levels will remain between 3,500 and 4,000 feet through Friday. White Pass and Stevens Pass should receive several inches of snow through the end of the work week. Snoqualmie Pass will likely just see a rain and snow mix at times. Snow levels will remain high enough that impacts on I-90 should remain minimal. Snow levels will be between 3,500 and 4,500 feet through Friday, bringing snow to the higher passes. (FOX 13 Seattle) The National Weather Service has issued a Winter Weather Advisory for the northern and southern Washington Cascades with 8 to 12 inches possible at the passes and up to two feet possible the higher up the mountain you go. White Pass and Stevens Pass will see several inches of snow through Friday. (FOX 13 Seattle) Light showers will continue through Sunday, though the weekend ahead looks more dry than wet. Drier weather looks to return by the middle of next week. November will start cool and showery at times in Seattle. (FOX 13 Seattle) MORE NEWS FROM FOX SEATTLE [Seattle street takeover near Space Needle leads to fireworks attack on police](https://www.fox13seattle.com/news/seattle-street-takeover-fireworks) [WA nears energy crisis as Amazon funds nuclear reactors, sparking controversy](https://www.fox13seattle.com/news/wa-faces-energy-crisis) ['Belltown Hellcat' Miles Hudson back in jail for Renton, WA warrants](https://www.fox13seattle.com/news/belltown-hellcat-arrested-missing-dv-hearing) [IKEA parody installation 'STOR' opens in downtown Seattle](https://www.fox13seattle.com/news/ikea-parody-stor-downtown-seattle) [Nooksack tribe criticized over eviction of disenrolled WA families](https://www.fox13seattle.com/news/nooksack-eviction-disenroll) To get the best local news, weather and sports in Seattle for free, sign up for the daily [FOX Seattle Newsletter](https://www.fox13seattle.com/newsletters). Download the free FOX LOCAL mobile app in the [Apple App Store](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/fox-local-live-news/id6443995100) or [Google Play Store](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.fox.fts.android&hl=en_US&pli=1) for live Seattle news, top stories, weather updates and more local and national coverage, plus 24/7 streaming coverage from across the nation.

author: Sean Murphy
title: Glasgow Irish restaurant famous for its viral spice bags closes after under a year - Glasgow Live
text:
A Glasgow restaurant which opened in spring last promising to give Glasgow foodies a "unique Irish tapas experience" has now sadly closed just under a year later.
33 Ashton Lane, previously home to the Wee Curry Shop, aimed to bring the "modern taste of Ireland" to the west end. It quickly became known for its take on the viral food trend known as the spice bag , as well as other exciting takes on Irish cuisine.
Sadly, the team behind it have now taken to social media to confirm they will be closing their current venue, but wouldn't rule out returning in some other format in the future.
They wrote: "Some things don‚Äôt work out.
"It‚Äôs with a heavy heart that we must let you know that our time on Ashton Lane has come to an abrupt end. Our team have worked incredibly hard to create a space for something new in Glasgow‚Äôs hospitality industry and we truly do believe that our food is unrivalled."
They then thanked their staff thanked their staff said they will continue to support them.
Finishing by stating, "this is goodbye for now", they added that "there‚Äôs no saying what the future holds".
Here's hoping it heralds a return at some point as it would be great to see them revived in some format.
Fans described the news as heart breaking, with one stating the food was "amazing" every time they'd been.
While another added that it was a "big loss" for Ashton Lane, writing: "Very saddened to hear this. The Hospitality and food was amazing."

author: hola.com
title: Fishermen save three dozen dogs from Mississippi lake
text:
By the time fishermen spotted the first head bobbing above the water, the 38 dogs were exhausted and struggling to stay alive.
The hound dogs had plunged into a large Mississippi lake while chasing a deer, a diversion during a fox hunt. Bob Gist, who was fishing on the lake, knew they had no chance.
"A deer can swim the Mississippi River, and those dogs are not going to catch a deer in the water," he recalled Friday (local time).
They weren't going to survive, either, Gist and the others realised ‚Äî unless someone acted right away. The insurance agent from Jonesboro, Arkansas, along with friend Brad Carlisle and guide Jordan Chrestman, headed over in their small boat.
"There were dogs everywhere," Gist said. "They were kind of swimming in circles and didn‚Äôt know which direction to go."
ADVERTISEMENT
As the dogs' frantic owners watched from the shore, the three men started grabbing whatever dogs they could. There were too many to all fit on the bass boat, so three trips to shore were needed.
A photo Gist took during the rescue shows Carlisle standing and grinning in mirrored sunglasses, with more than a half-dozen of the hound dogs perched on the bow. Numbers from the fox hunt are painted on their sides.
Other dogs are standing behind the seats ‚Äî two of them calmly looking ahead as Chrestman, beside them, steers.
"The hero here is Jordan," Gist said, as the guide had recognised the danger and sped the boat over. "If it wasn‚Äôt for Jordan, there would have been 38 dead dogs."
The dogs had probably been in the water for about 15 or 20 minutes by then, Gist said. Some of them were so worn out that the men had to reach into the water and lift their heads out. Each dog was then heaved aboard.
By the time the last were rescued, they had been in the water for 45 minutes to an hour, Gist said.
Dogs, especially when hunting, can "follow game relentlessly, as in this case", said Chris Gurner, a natural resource specialist with the US Army Corps of Engineers, which patrols Grenada Lake ‚Äî but he called it rare for them to go that far from shore. Even though they were on a fox hunt, it‚Äôs not unusual for the dogs to go after any animal that startled them, he said.
ADVERTISEMENT
‚ÄúOpportunities to help somebody are in front of us all the time,‚Äù Gist said. ‚ÄúSometimes if you see something, do something.‚Äù

author: Elisabeth McGowan
title: Taylor Swift Will Reportedly Attend Travis Kelce‚Äôs First Chiefs Game of the 2024 Season
text:
A new report claims that Arrowhead Stadium has already made security arrangements for the pop star‚Äôs attendance.
Taylor Swift will reportedly attend her boyfriend Travis Kelce ‚Äòs first Kansas City Chiefs game of the season. The news comes nearly one year after the 34-year-old pop singer went to her first Chiefs game to support the 34-year-old football tight end.
On Thursday, September 5, The New York Times reported that Arrowhead Stadium in Kansas City, Missouri, has made security arrangements for Taylor for the game against the Baltimore Ravens. Kickoff is set to take place at 8:20 p.m.
Neither Taylor nor Travis has publicly confirmed her plans to attend the game.
Earlier that day, Travis‚Äô CBS Mornings interview aired. In it, the athlete opened up about the impact of his and Taylor‚Äôs relationship on his personal life. Since going public with their romance in September 2023, the couple have faced overwhelming attention from both sports fans and Swifties.
üìπ| Travis Kelce on his fav songs performed at The Eras Tour:
"I got a bunch of them. They're all my favourite, literally every single one. I sing along to all of them" pic.twitter.com/NHiyxdnYuW
‚Äî Taylor Swift Updates ü©∂ (@swifferupdates) September 5, 2024
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the life I chose, I guess,‚Äù Travis acknowledged during his interview. ‚ÄúI have fun with it. It comes with the territory of wanting to do fun activities like this and signing up for cool sponsorships like this and endorsements.‚Äù
The rest of the Kelces have adjusted to the spotlight as well, Travis said.
‚ÄúMama Kelce is having so much fun,‚Äù he said, referring to his mother, Donna Kelce . ‚ÄúI think my dad is slowly getting more comfortable with it, and Jason [ Kelce ] has always been a pro at it.‚Äù
Since Travis quickly became a Swiftie, he also gushed over his girlfriend‚Äôs music. When asked which of Taylor‚Äôs songs is his favorite, the NFL player said, ‚ÄúOh, a bunch of them.‚Äù
‚ÄúThey‚Äôre all my favorite, literally, every single one,‚Äù Travis said during his interview. ‚ÄúYou see me at a concert, you‚Äôll see me singing them all.‚Äù
After going public with their romance, Taylor showed up to multiple Chiefs games in the fall of 2023. As for Travis, he flew around the world to support the Grammy Award winner during her Eras Tour. In February of this year, Taylor high-tailed back from Tokyo to Las Vegas to cheer on her boyfriend at the 2024 Super Bowl. Following the Chiefs‚Äô victory, the ‚ÄúKarma‚Äù artist and the athlete shared an embrace and a kiss on the field.
